summary: This is a sealed court filing by Jeffrey Epstein's defense attorneys notifying the court of the continued pendency of a federal criminal action against Epstein despite his state court sentencing. It reveals the existence of a confidential deferred-prosecution agreement between Epstein and the U.S. Attorney's Office, which suspends the federal grand jury investigation for 33 months contingent on Epstein not breaching the agreement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant in both a federal criminal action and a Florida state criminal case. He entered into a confidential deferred-prosecution agreement with the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Ann Marie C. Villafana
persons.context: Represented the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in entering into the deferred-prosecution agreement with Jeffrey Epstein and had prepared a federal indictment against him.

persons.name: Guy A. Lewis
persons.context: Attorney from the law firm Lewis Tein, P.L., who signed this notice on behalf of defendant Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jack A. Goldberger
persons.context: Attorney from the law firm Atterbury, Goldberger & Weiss, P.A., who also signed as an attorney for defendant Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Michael R. Tein
persons.context: Signed the certificate of service for this sealed court filing.

persons.name: Jane Doe No. 2
persons.context: The plaintiff in the civil case against Jeffrey Epstein, referenced only by pseudonym in this sealed filing.

connections.description: Prosecutor and defendant who entered into a confidential deferred-prosecution agreement.

events.title: Epstein Sentenced in Florida State Case
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was sentenced in the Florida state criminal case (State of Florida v. Jeffrey Epstein).

events.title: Deferred-Prosecution Agreement Signed
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office and Jeffrey Epstein entered into a confidential deferred-prosecution agreement, suspending the federal grand jury investigation.

events.title: Sealed Court Filing Submitted
events.description: Epstein's attorneys filed this sealed notice informing the court of the continued pendency of the federal criminal action.

keyFacts: A confidential deferred-prosecution agreement was signed on September 24, 2007, between Jeffrey Epstein and the U.S. Attorney's Office, which suspended the federal grand jury investigation.
The agreement was contingent on Epstein not breaching its terms for 33 months starting from June 30, 2008, keeping the federal criminal action pending during that period.
Assistant U.S. Attorney Ann Marie C. Villafana had already prepared a federal criminal indictment against Epstein prior to the agreement.
This document reveals the parallel legal tracks: a resolved state criminal case and a suspended but pending federal criminal action.
The filing was made under seal in a civil case where 'Jane Doe No. 2' is the plaintiff against Epstein.
